ns2:Service.description: The EVSGridService grid service, created with caGrid Introduce, version:.99999.
ns2:Service.name: EVSGridService

ns5:UMLClass.description: This class will contain the input parameters used by caCORE EVS API to retrieve Description Logic vocabulary names

ns5:UMLAttribute.description: Vocabulary Name for the Description Logic Concept
ns5:UMLAttribute.name: vocabularyName

ns5:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.
The words or language units by which a thing is known.
This class encapsulates the attributes of EVS DescLogicConcept object.

ns7:UMLClass.description: The source is a knowledge base.

ns7:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A shortened form of a word or phrase.
The words or language units by which a thing is known.
Description; a statement that represents something in words.

ns7:UMLAttribute.description: An integer value in the database to uniquely identify the particular source entry.
ns7:UMLAttribute.name: id

ns7:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ns9:UMLClass.description: This class will contain the input parameters used by caCORE EVS API to retrieve Description Logic Concept data

ns9:UMLAttribute.description: Any string value used for searching
ns9:UMLAttribute.name: searchTerm

ns9:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The activity of looking thoroughly in order to find something or someone; an operation that determines whether one or more of a set of items has a specified property.
A word or expression used for some particular thing.

ns9:UMLAttribute.description: A valid Description Logic vocabulary name such as NCI_Thesaurus, GO, HL7 etc
ns9:UMLAttribute.name: vocabularyName

ns9:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.
A positive return on a search in a database or by way of a search engine on the Internet; the request for and delivery of a file (such as a Web page) on a server.
Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.
the largest possible quantity or degree.
This class encapsulates the attributes of EVS DescLogicConcept object.
A value that is passed to a routine.

The NCI EVS is set of services and resources that address NCI's needs for controlled vocabulary. The EVS Project is a collaborative effort of the Center for Bioinformatics and the NCI Office of Communications. The NCI Thesaurus, which is a biomedical thesaurus created specifically to meet the needs of the NCI, is produced by the NCI EVS project. The NCI Thesaurus is provided under an open content license. The EVS Project also produces the NCI Metathesaurus, which is based on NLM's Unified Medical Language System Metathesaurus supplemented with additional cancer-centric vocabulary. In addition the EVS Project provides NCI with licenses for MedDRA, SNOMED, ICD-O-3, and other proprietary vocabularies. (http://ncicb.nci.nih.gov/core/EVS)
The activity of looking thoroughly in order to find something or someone; an operation that determines whether one or more of a set of items has a specified property.

ns11:UMLClass.description: The DescLogicConcept class represents the fundamental vocabulary entity in the NCI Thesaurus.

ns11:UMLAttribute.description: This attribute holds association information between concepts
ns11:UMLAttribute.name: inverseAssociationCollection

ns11:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: An inverse association has the same basic meaning of an association but is expressed in the opposite direction.
An object that holds the values or locations of other objects.

ns11:UMLAttribute.description: Stores the inverse relationship between two concepts
ns11:UMLAttribute.name: inverseRoleCollection

ns11:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: An object that holds the values or locations of other objects.

An inverse role has the same basic meaning of a role entity but is expressed in the opposite direction. For computational reasons these can't be directly modeled in the NCI Thesaurus but are computed after the fact.

ns11:UMLAttribute.description: The namespaceId is used to identify a set of concepts within a terminology such as the NCI Thesaurus.
ns11:UMLAttribute.name: namespaceId

ns11:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

In general, a namespace is an abstract container, which is or could be filled by names, or technical terms, or words, and these represent or stand for real-world things. A description logic terminology namespace is a collection of Kind, Role, Property and Concept definitions. As in the programming, context namespaces are intended to allow multiple knowledge bases to reside in the same physical database. (from Wikipedia and Apelon)

ns11:UMLAttribute.description: Sets this value to 'true' if a concept is retired.
ns11:UMLAttribute.name: isRetired

ns11:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Indicates that a concept is no longer an active concept in the NCI Thesaurus. (caBIO)

An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true. The indicator usually takes the form of a single binary digit, or bit (either 0 or 1). (from Dictionary of Computers)

ns11:UMLAttribute.description: Sets this value to 'true' if a concept has children
ns11:UMLAttribute.name: hasChildren

ns11:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A concept is the basic unit of information contained in the Thesaurus. They describe sets of individuals in a given domain. A concept has a name, belongs to a Namespace and exists in relation to other concepts. The vertical relationships consist of "isa" statements that form a logical hierarchy (taxonomy or subsumption graph). In general, concepts above a given concept are referred to as superconcepts or parents and those below as subconcepts or children. In addition, there are horizontal named realationships between concepts called Roles, binary relations between concepts that provide a machine-interpretable definition of a concept and the means for discrimination of sibling concepts. A concept may also include Properties, named slots that allow attachment of external information to concepts.

A son or daughter of any age, including biological offspring and sometimes including unborn children, adopted children, stepchildren, foster children and children born outside of marriage; person under an age specified by law.

ns11:UMLAttribute.description: This is an unique code associated with a concept within the specified vocabulary.
ns11:UMLAttribute.name: code

ns11:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ns11:UMLAttribute.description: Stores the Semantic_Type property value for this DescLogicConcept
ns11:UMLAttribute.name: semanticTypeVector

ns11:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The Semantic Type is the basic category or categories that describe a Concept. In general, applying semantic types aids in allowing users (or computer programs) to draw conclusions about concepts by virtue of the categories to which they have been assigned. We use a set of Semantic types developed for the UMLS Metathesaurus. There are currently 134 Semantic types in the UMLS.

ns11:UMLAttribute.description: Specifies the name of the concept.
ns11:UMLAttribute.name: name

ns11:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ns11:UMLAttribute.description: This value is set to 'true' if a concept has a parent
ns11:UMLAttribute.name: hasParents

ns11:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A concept is the basic unit of information contained in the Thesaurus. They describe sets of individuals in a given domain. A concept has a name, belongs to a Namespace and exists in relation to other concepts. The vertical relationships consist of "isa" statements that form a logical hierarchy (taxonomy or subsumption graph). In general, concepts above a given concept are referred to as superconcepts or parents and those below as subconcepts or children. In addition, there are horizontal named realationships between concepts called Roles, binary relations between concepts that provide a machine-interpretable definition of a concept and the means for discrimination of sibling concepts. A concept may also include Properties, named slots that allow attachment of external information to concepts.
A mother or a father; the immediate progenitor.
This class encapsulates the attributes of EVS DescLogicConcept object.

ns13:UMLClass.description: This class will contain the input parameters used by caCORE EVS API to retrieve Meta Thesaurus Concepts

ns13:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: An operation that segregates items into groups according to a specified criterion.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

The type of an expression with two possible values, "true" and "false". Also, a variable of Boolean type or a function with Boolean arguments or result. The most common Boolean functions are AND, OR and NOT. (http://foldoc.doc.ic.ac.uk/foldoc/foldoc.cgi?Boolean)
Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.
the largest possible quantity or degree.
A positive return on a search in a database or by way of a search engine on the Internet; the request for and delivery of a file (such as a Web page) on a server.

ns13:UMLAttribute.description: Source abbreviation. Each source has a abbreviation that can uniquely identify a source
ns13:UMLAttribute.name: source

ns13:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A shortened form of a word or phrase.
An indicator of the particular group or agency that supplied a specific term.

ns13:UMLAttribute.description: Any String value or a valid concept unique identifier. A concept unique identifier is used to uniquely identify concepts in the MetaThesaurus
ns13:UMLAttribute.name: searchTerm

ns13:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The activity of looking thoroughly in order to find something or someone; an operation that determines whether one or more of a set of items has a specified property.
A word or expression used for some particular thing.

ns13:UMLAttribute.description: Set to true for short response
ns13:UMLAttribute.name: shortResponse

ns13:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A statement (either spoken or written) that is made in reply to a question or request or criticism or accusation; a statement that solves a problem or explains how to solve the problem.

The type of an expression with two possible values, "true" and "false". Also, a variable of Boolean type or a function with Boolean arguments or result. The most common Boolean functions are AND, OR and NOT. (http://foldoc.doc.ic.ac.uk/foldoc/foldoc.cgi?Boolean)
Having little (physical) length or seeming to be limited in (temporal) duration.

ns13:UMLAttribute.description: This value is set to true if a concept unique identifier is used as a search term
ns13:UMLAttribute.name: cui

ns13:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The type of an expression with two possible values, "true" and "false". Also, a variable of Boolean type or a function with Boolean arguments or result. The most common Boolean functions are AND, OR and NOT. (http://foldoc.doc.ic.ac.uk/foldoc/foldoc.cgi?Boolean)
A concept unique identifier within the NCI Enterprise Vocabulary Service's NCI Metathesaurus.
This class encapsulates the attributes of EVS MetaThesaurus Concept object.
A value that is passed to a routine.

The NCI EVS is set of services and resources that address NCI's needs for controlled vocabulary. The EVS Project is a collaborative effort of the Center for Bioinformatics and the NCI Office of Communications. The NCI Thesaurus, which is a biomedical thesaurus created specifically to meet the needs of the NCI, is produced by the NCI EVS project. The NCI Thesaurus is provided under an open content license. The EVS Project also produces the NCI Metathesaurus, which is based on NLM's Unified Medical Language System Metathesaurus supplemented with additional cancer-centric vocabulary. In addition the EVS Project provides NCI with licenses for MedDRA, SNOMED, ICD-O-3, and other proprietary vocabularies. (http://ncicb.nci.nih.gov/core/EVS)
The activity of looking thoroughly in order to find something or someone; an operation that determines whether one or more of a set of items has a specified property.

ns15:UMLClass.description: MetaThesaurusConcept is the fundamental vocabulary entity in the NCI MetaThesaurus.

ns15:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ns15:UMLAttribute.description: CUI is the Concept Unique Identifier within the MetaThesaurus.
ns15:UMLAttribute.name: cui

ns15:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: In the Unified Medical Language System (UMLS) of the National Library of Medicine (NLM) the concept unique identifier (CUI) is an 8-character identifier beginning with the letter "C" and followed by 7 digits. Each concept is assigned such a CUI. The CUI has no intrinsic meaning but remains constant through time and across versions.
Synonyms are ways of referring to a concept that are valid alternatives to the preferred name that NCI uses to refer to the concept.
The act of gathering something together.
This class encapsulates the attributes of EVS MetaThesaurus Concept object.

ns17:UMLClass.description: This class will contain the input parameters used by caCORE EVS API to retrieve History data

ns17:UMLAttribute.description: A valid Description Logic vocabulary Name such as NCI_Thesaurus, GO, HL7, etc
ns17:UMLAttribute.name: vocabularyName

ns17:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ns17:UMLAttribute.description: A valid code of a DescLogicConcept
ns17:UMLAttribute.name: conceptCode

ns17:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A concept unique identifier within the NCI Enterprise Vocabulary Service's NCI Thesaurus.
Record; anything, e.g. a document, providing permanent evidence of or information about past events.
A value that is passed to a routine.

The NCI EVS is set of services and resources that address NCI's needs for controlled vocabulary. The EVS Project is a collaborative effort of the Center for Bioinformatics and the NCI Office of Communications. The NCI Thesaurus, which is a biomedical thesaurus created specifically to meet the needs of the NCI, is produced by the NCI EVS project. The NCI Thesaurus is provided under an open content license. The EVS Project also produces the NCI Metathesaurus, which is based on NLM's Unified Medical Language System Metathesaurus supplemented with additional cancer-centric vocabulary. In addition the EVS Project provides NCI with licenses for MedDRA, SNOMED, ICD-O-3, and other proprietary vocabularies. (http://ncicb.nci.nih.gov/core/EVS)
The activity of looking thoroughly in order to find something or someone; an operation that determines whether one or more of a set of items has a specified property.
The tracking of concept evolution over the lifetime of a vocabulary, includes concept creation, modification, merges, splits, and retirements.

ns19:UMLClass.description: The HistoryRecord holds history information for the specified concept

ns19:UMLAttribute.description: This is an unique code associated with a concept within the specified vocabulary.
ns19:UMLAttribute.name: descLogicConceptCode

ns19:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.
This class encapsulates the attributes of EVS DescLogicConcept object.
Record; anything, e.g. a document, providing permanent evidence of or information about past events.
The tracking of concept evolution over the lifetime of a vocabulary, includes concept creation, modification, merges, splits, and retirements.

ns21:UMLClass.description: This class will contain the input parameters used by caCORE EVS API to retrieve Meta Thesaurus Concepts.

ns21:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: In the NCI Thesaurus an atom consists of a term string, a term type, a term source, and an optional term code. They can be thought of as synonyms or alternative valid forms of a particular concept. This information resides in the property FULL_SYN.
A system of numbered categories for representation of data.
A shortened form of a word or phrase.
A value that is passed to a routine.

The NCI EVS is set of services and resources that address NCI's needs for controlled vocabulary. The EVS Project is a collaborative effort of the Center for Bioinformatics and the NCI Office of Communications. The NCI Thesaurus, which is a biomedical thesaurus created specifically to meet the needs of the NCI, is produced by the NCI EVS project. The NCI Thesaurus is provided under an open content license. This class encapsulates the attributes of EVS MetaThesaurus Concept object.

ns24:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A service available on a system that coordinates resources that are not subject to central control, using open, general purpose protocols and interfaces to deliver nontrivial qualities of services.

ns25:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Services that are needed to maintain the running of a grid, including monitoring and discovery service, security management service (authentication and authorization), identifier naming and resolution service, query and federated query service, and workflow management service.
